dmca.title: [TP-C605026M] Notice of Infringement - VU082406-t01
dmca.body:
-----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Posted At: Thursday, August 24, 2006 9:05 AM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [TP-C605026M] Notice of Infringement - VU082406-t01 Subject: [TP-C605026M] Notice of Infringement - VU082406-t01 From: abuse@theplanet.com Subject: [TP-C605026M] Notice of Infringement - VU082406-t01 Reference: [TP-C605026M] For your review. Thank you, Policy Enforcement The Planet Internet Services, Inc. http://www.theplanet.com/legal/ ==== Original Message ==== 1. Notice of Infringement - VU082406-t01 Added by system at Thursday, Aug 24 2006 02:03 pm X-MailFrom: ttyre@theesa.com X-RcptTo: abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com Received: from [172.16.214.180] by [10.5.0.64] (abacus) for ; Thu Aug 24 13:52:40 2006 Return-path: Delivery-date: Thu, 24 Aug 2006 13:52:40 -0500 Received: from smtp02.theplanet.com ([70.87.6.111]) by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from ttyre@theesa.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GGKJj-000HcM-Jx for abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com; Thu, 24 Aug 2006 13:52:39 -0500 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Thu, 24 Aug 2006 13:52:28 -0500 Received: from mx01.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.180] helo=mx01.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from ttyre@theesa.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1GGKJY-0005xU-NO for abuse@theplanet.com; Thu, 24 Aug 2006 13:52:28 -0500 Received: from dns1-bos.paetec.net ([64.80.233.226]) by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from ttyre@theesa.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1GGKJU-000Hae-8Z for abuse@theplanet.com; Thu, 24 Aug 2006 13:52:24 -0500 Received: from hook.theesa.COM (mail.theesa.com [63.138.80.34]) by dns1-bos.paetec.net (8.13.6/8.13.6) with ESMTP id k7OIqGIa013681 for ; Thu, 24 Aug 2006 14:52:22 -0400 (EDT) X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5.7226.0 Content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C6C7AE.6B6D5FC7" Subject: Notice of Infringement - VU082406-t01 Date: Thu, 24 Aug 2006 14:52:16 -0400 Message-ID: X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: Notice of Infringement - VU082406-t01 Thread-Index: AcbHqr1FYxoNhzlAR7WVqslygEOAdw== From: "Timothy Tyre" To: Cc: "Jake Snyder" Received-SPF: none (mx01.filter.theplanet.com: 64.80.233.226 is neither permitted nor denied by domain of theesa.com) client-ip=64.80.233.226; envelope-from=ttyre@theesa.com; helo=dns1-bos.paetec.net; X-OriginalArrivalTime: 24 Aug 2006 18:52:28.0725 (UTC) FILETIME=[72951E50:01C6C7AE] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) Entertainment Software Association 575 7th Street, NW, Suite 300 Washington, DC 20004 USA Attention: Intellectual Property Enforcement Telephone: 202-223-2400 E-mail: dmcaresponse@theesa.com August 24, 2006 Dear ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. , The Entertainment Software Association ("ESA") is a U.S. trade association that represents the intellectual property interests of numerous companies in the video gaming industry (hereinafter collectively referred to as "ESA members"). ESA members whose trademark and other intellectual property rights may be infringed as described herein give ESA authorization to act on their behalf. ESA is providing this notice to make ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. aware of material on its network or system that infringes the exclusive trademark rights of one of more ESA members. ESA has a good faith belief that the IP address 69.93.165.2 infringes the rights of one of more ESA members by offering for sale products protected by trademark. The infringing materials include but are not limited to: World of War Artwork. Specific links include: http://www.warcraft-cash.com The unauthorized product(s) or the material deemed infringing appears on or is made available through the above-listed IP address and are hereinafter referred to as "Infringing Material." Based on the information at its disposal on August 24, 2006, ESA has a good faith belief that the Infringing Material is not authorized by the trademark owner, any licensee or agent thereof, or the law. Accordingly, ESA hereby requests ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. to immediately remove, or disable access to, the Infringing Material detailed above. ESA believes that the information in this notification is accurate. Under penalty of perjury, I hereby affirm that ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose exclusive trademark rights we believe to be infringed upon as described herein. ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. may contact ESA at the above-listed contact details, with email preferred. Please include the above-noted Reference Number in the subject line of all email correspondence. Thank you for your cooperation and prompt response in this matter. Sincerely, Intellectual Property Enforcement Entertainment Software Association ---------------------- Timothy S. Tyre Anti-Piracy Associate Entertainment Software Association 575 7th Street, NW Suite 300 Washington, DC 20004 Phone: (202) 223-2400 Direct: (202) 903-2314 ttyre@theesa.com MIME element (text/html)

Entertainment Software Association

575 7th Street, NW, Suite 300

Washington, DC 20004 USA

 

Attention:  Intellectual Property Enforcement

Telephone:  202-223-2400

E-mail:  dmcaresponse@theesa.com

 

August 24, 2006

 

Dear ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.,

 

The Entertainment Software Association (“ESA”) is a U.S. trade association that represents the intellectual property interests of numerous companies in the video gaming industry (hereinafter collectively referred to as “ESA members”).  ESA members whose trademark and other intellectual property rights may be infringed as described herein give ESA authorization to act on their behalf.

 

ESA is providing this notice to make ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. aware of material on its network or system that infringes the exclusive trademark rights of one of more ESA members.  ESA has a good faith belief that the IP address 69.93.165.2< /a> infringes the rights of one of more ESA members by offering for sale products protected by trademark.  The infringing materials include but are not limited to: World of War Artwork.

 

Specific links include:

http://www.warcraft-cash.com< /font>

 

The unauthorized product(s) or the material deemed infringing appears on or is made available through the above-listed IP address and are hereinafter referred to as "Infringing Material."   Based on the information at its disposal on August 24, 2006, ESA has a good faith belief that the Infringing Material is not authorized by the trademark owner, any licensee or agent thereof, or the law. 

 

Accordingly, ESA hereby requests ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.  to immediately remove, or disable access to, the Infringing Material detailed above. ESA believes that the information in this notification is accurate.  Under penalty of perjury, I hereby affirm that ESA is authorized to act on behalf of ESA members whose exclusive trademark rights we believe to be infringed upon as described herein.  ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. may contact ESA at the above-listed contact details, with email preferred.  Please include the above-noted Reference Number in the subject line of all email correspondence.

 

Thank you for your cooperation and prompt response in this matter.

 

Sincerely,

 

Intellectual Property Enforcement

Entertainment Software Association

 

----------------------

Timothy S. Tyre

Anti-Piracy Associate

Entertainment Software Association

575 7th Street, NW Suite 300

Washington, DC 20004

Phone: (202) 223-2400

Direct: (202) 903-2314

ttyre@theesa.com
